meanings.definition: Receive (money, property, or a title) as an heir.
meanings.sent1: She will inherit her grandmother's antique jewelry.
meanings.sent2: He will inherit the family business when his father retires.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to inherit the dog's playful nature.
meanings.sent4: The new leader will inherit a company in financial turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The young prince will inherit the kingdom's vast lands and riches.

meanings.sent1: She seems to inherit her mother's artistic talent.
meanings.sent2: Children can inherit their parents' eye color.
meanings.sent3: The puppy appeared to inherit the older dog's mischievous streak.
meanings.sent4: He will inherit his grandfather's wisdom and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The student will inherit a love for learning from her family.

meanings.definition: Come into possession of (a situation or condition).
meanings.sent1: After the retirement, she will inherit the role of manager.
meanings.sent2: He will inherit a sense of responsibility when he becomes a parent.
meanings.sent3: The new employee will inherit a challenging project.
meanings.sent4: The team will inherit a difficult task to complete.
meanings.sent5: The student will inherit a sense of accomplishment after finishing the project.
